fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Morrisons sells Jersey stores Wm Morrison is selling the stores it acquired in Jersey and Guernsey as part of the Safeway takeover in a £51m deal. The stores are being bought by Yorkie Holdings, part of CI Traders which is based in Jersey and listed on the Alternative Investment Market. Morrisons said the deal confirmed its strategy of focusing on the United Kingdom. £3m investment for Hearcare Specsavers, Britain's largest optical retailer, hopes to become its leading hearing aid provider by doubling its Hearcare business this year. The company, which has 50 stores providing hearing tests and selling digital hearing aids, is to invest more than £3m. Firms less optimistic Business optimism has fallen for the first time in a year, according to research from BDO Stoy Hayward. It said the UK economy is facing potential pressure from the housing market, the consumer spending slowdown and uncertainty surrounding the election.
